intro: Tetranthera pallens, commonly known as the white tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tetranthera pallens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
